subject: Sexual Health
title: Brain Regions and Sexuality
description: A short lesson to help you apply Brain Regions and Sexuality.

hook.text: Multiple brain regions work together like an orchestra to create the full experience of human sexuality.

buildup.text: The hypothalamus regulates hormones and drive. The amygdala processes emotional and sensory sexual cues.

discovery.text: The nucleus accumbens provides the reward and pleasure signals. The prefrontal cortex adds judgment and context.

twist.text: No single brain area controls sexuality. Damage to any one region can alter sexual function in unexpected ways.

climax.text: The distributed nature of sexual processing explains why sexuality is so complex and individual.

punchline.text: Many brain regions, one unified sexual experience.

quiz.question: Which brain area provides reward and pleasure signals during sex?
